pullRequest.body:
In this PR, it is shown that when suitable coproducts exists in a category satisfying `[MonoCoprod C]`, then if `X : I → C` and `ι : J → I` is an injective map, the canonical morphism `∐ (X ∘ ι) ⟶ ∐ X` is a monomorphism.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7870398122/job/21471492489)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7870398122/job/21471491760)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7870398122/job/21471492264)

What about adding as a corollary:

```suggestion
section

variable [MonoCoprod C] (X : I → C) (c : Cofan X) (h : IsColimit c)

lemma inj_mono_of_injective (i : I)
    [HasCoproduct (fun (k : (Set.range (fun _ : Unit ↦ i)).compl) => X k.1)] :
    Mono (Cofan.inj c i) := by
  let ι : Unit → I := fun _ ↦ i
  have hinj : Function.Injective ι := fun _ _ _ ↦ rfl
  let c₁ : Cofan (X ∘ ι) := Cofan.mk (X i) (fun _ ↦ 𝟙 _)
  let hc₁ : IsColimit c₁ := mkCofanColimit _ (fun s => s.inj ())
  show Mono (Cofan.IsColimit.desc hc₁ (fun _ => c.inj i))
  exact mono_of_injective X ι hinj c c₁ h hc₁

end
```

And similarly here:
```suggestion
lemma inj_mono_of_injective' [HasCoproduct X] (i : I)
    [HasCoproduct (fun (k : (Set.range (fun _ : Unit ↦ i)).compl) => X k.1)] :
    Mono (Sigma.ι X i) :=
  inj_mono_of_injective X _ (colimit.isColimit _) i
```

(This comment is made obsolete by my other comment, but FYI)

It's a bit awkward, but I think the preferred spelling of this is
```suggestion
  let φ : J ⊕ ((Set.range ι)ᶜ : Set _) → I := fun i => match i with
```
as per the [docstring of Set.compl](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Init/Set.html#Set.compl).

It's possible to do this using existing building blocks:
```suggestion
  classical
  let e := ((Equiv.ofInjective ι hι).sumCongr (Equiv.refl _)).trans (Equiv.Set.sumCompl _)
  refine mono_binaryCofanSum_inl' (Cofan.mk c.pt (fun i' => c.inj (e i'))) _ _ ?_
```

I wonder if we should prefer the spelling
```suggestion
    Mono (Sigma.map' ι (fun j => 𝟙 (X ∘ ι) j)) :=
```
here. The two maps are not defeq as the `map'` spelling introduces a composition with an identity that's not there in your version, but `map'` is supposed to be the general "map sigma into other sigma", so it would be nice to have your result for `map'`. Maybe we want both?
Thanks for the suggestion! I have added the `map'` version.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Limits/MonoCoprod): inclusions of subcoproducts are mono
